content.webTitle: England to play Twenty20 against Australia

fields.headline: Australia up for Twenty20
fields.bodyText: After the announcement that Twenty20 cricket is seeking Olympic recognition, it has been confirmed that the first international match in the shrunken format will be played next summer between England and Australia at the Rose Bowl, Hampshire's ground, on June 13, before the Ashes series. The NatWest series follows, also featuring Bangladesh. By then Test cricket's minnows will have played their first two Tests in England, at Lord's on May 26 and Chester-le-Street on June 3. The NatWest series will begin at The Oval on June 16 with England v Bangladesh, with the final at Lord's on July 2. After the series comes the Challenge, three one-day games between England and Australia on July 7, 10 and 12, before the five-Test Ashes series, which starts on July 21 at Lord's. 2005 international schedule: May 26 First Test v Bangladesh, Lord's. June 3 Second Test, Durham. 13 Twenty20 match v Australia Southampton. 16 Triangular series England v Bangladesh, The Oval. 18 TS Australia v Bangladesh, Cardiff. 19 TS England v Australia, Bristol. 21 TS England v Bangladesh (day/night) Nottingham. 22 England v Australia (d/n) Durham. 25 TS Australia v Bangladesh, Manchester. 26 TS England v Bangladesh, Leeds. 28 TS England v Australia (d/n) Birmingham. 30 TS Australia v Bangladesh, Canterbury. July 2 TS final, Lord's. 7 ODI First match v Australia, Leeds. 10 ODI v Australia, Lord's. 12 ODI v Australia, The Oval. 21-25 First Test v Australia, Lord's. Aug 4-8 Second Test, Birmingham. 11-15 Third Test, Manchester. 25-29 Fourth Test, Nottingham. Sept 8-12 Fifth Test, The Oval.
